command.name: LISTOP
command.desc: LISTOP lists users with access to the channel. You can use either -n or -l, but not both. If you use -l, it will display all ops in the channel with that level. If you use -n, it will show the entry for the nick you specify. You must be an op on the channel in question to use this command.

ex.pre: To list all of the ops on #Sorcery:
To find out the op level of Raistlin on #Sorcery:
To list all ops with level 10 access in #Sorcery:
